Adapted by Roman writers. Plautus. This was the material on which the Roman play-wrights went to work. The first Latin comedy was performed on the Roman stage 240 B.c., the year following the close of the First Punic War. lt was adapted from the Greek by Livius Andronicus, himself a Greek taken at Tarentum. Five years later Gnaeus Naevius, probably a Campanian, brought out the first of his long series of dramaS, famous sor the strength and purity of their language3 and also for the violence with which their author, alone among Roman writers imitating the true spirit of the Old Comedy, assailed public men.
